intro: Hybosema ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert hyssop, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low moisture conditions. Hybosema ehrenbergii is often found in rocky habitats and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
